info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN AND EFFINGHAM COUNTIES... At 557 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Kildare, or 11 miles northwest of Springfield, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Oliver, Shawnee, Egypt and Kildare. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
